name: Cross-Sectional Study
description: Data is collected at a single point in time from a defined group.

forms.name: Patient Demographics
forms.description: Collects basic demographic information of patients.

forms.name: Medical History
forms.description: Captures the medical history of patients.

name: Longitudinal Study
description: Data is collected from the same subjects repeatedly over a period of time.

forms.name: Baseline Form
forms.description: Initial data collection form at the start of the study.

forms.name: Follow-up Form
forms.description: Used to collect data at follow-up visits.

forms.name: Visit Reports
forms.description: Detailed reports of each visit during the study.

name: Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)
description: Participants are randomly assigned to different groups to compare interventions.

forms.name: Screening Form
forms.description: Used to screen participants before enrollment.

forms.name: Treatment Form
forms.description: Captures details of the treatment given to participants.

forms.name: Adverse Events
forms.description: Records any adverse events reported during the trial.

name: Cohort Study
description: A group of participants is followed over time to assess the outcomes related to certain exposures.

forms.name: Enrollment Form
forms.description: Captures data when participants enroll in the study.

forms.name: Outcome Tracking
forms.description: Tracks outcomes over time for each participant.

name: Case-Control Study
description: Compares participants with a particular condition (cases) to those without it (controls).

forms.name: Case Data Form
forms.description: Captures detailed information about the cases.

forms.name: Control Data Form
forms.description: Captures detailed information about the controls.

name: Registry Study
description: Ongoing collection of data for a particular disease or condition.

forms.name: Patient Enrollment
forms.description: Used to enroll patients in the registry.

forms.name: Long-term Monitoring
forms.description: Tracks patients' conditions over a long period.
